info.title: Edge Device Communication API
info.description:
API specification for Edge Device (Jetson Orin Nano) communication with the 
IoT Broker and Archive Server in the Facial Recognition System.

## Overview

This specification covers:
- **Edge → IoT Broker**: Event submission, heartbeat, enrollment sync
- **IoT Broker → Edge**: WebSocket protocol (documented as x-websocket extension)
- **Edge → Archive Server**: Video clip upload, log batch shipping

## URL Structure

Production URL pattern:
```
https://{tenant}-bridge.qryde.net/iot-broker/api/data/...
```

Example: `https://acetaxi-bridge.qryde.net/iot-broker/api/data/devices`

## Device Authentication

Edge devices authenticate using:
- `X-Device-ID` header: Unique device identifier
- `Authorization: Bearer {token}`: Device JWT token (optional for some endpoints)

## Message Format (Socket.IO)

All event messages use the Socket.IO format with header + data structure:
```json
[
  { "header": { "to": "gateway", "from": "device-id", ... } },
  { "data": { "event_id": "...", "event_type": "...", "debug": [], ... } }
]
```

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all registered devices for the tenant.

Can filter by device capability type.

post.description:
Register a new IoT edge device.

**Required fields:** device_id, display_name, capability

After registration, send heartbeats to update status to "online".

get.description: Retrieve a specific device by its device ID.

post.description:
Update device heartbeat timestamp and status.

Should be called every 30 seconds.

Response may indicate if configuration or enrollment updates are available.

Submit one or more events using the Socket.IO message format.

Each message is an array of `[header, data]` where:
- **header**: Contains routing info (to, from, auth_token, command_id, timestamp)
- **data**: Contains the event payload with **required** `debug` field

The `debug` field is used for Graylog logging and must always be present (empty array if no debug info).

data.story: A person entered the room looking happy and engaged in conversation with others...

debug.message: Emotion event triggered by high valence score

post.summary: Submit emotion event with video clip
post.description:
Submit an emotion monitoring event with an attached video clip.

The video clip is sent as a base64-encoded MP4 string within the JSON payload.

**Video Specifications:**
- Duration: 15 seconds (10s pre-event + 5s post-event)
- Format: MP4 (H.264 or H.265)
- Encoding: Base64 string

**Required Fields:**
- `debug`: Array for Graylog entries (can be empty)

**Optional Fields:**
- `story`: VLM narrative description (~100 tokens)
- `video_clip`: Base64-encoded MP4
- `person_id`: Employee ID if person was identified

data.story: A person entered the room looking happy and engaged in conversation with others...

debug.message: Video clip captured for event cam-002_EV2-1706005800000

get.description: Retrieve events with optional filtering. Use /v1/events for new implementations.

post.description:
Submit a recognition or emotion event using the legacy flat format.
Use /v1/events for new implementations with Socket.IO format.

Publishes employee enrollment data (facial embedding) to all face recognition devices.

**How it works:**
1. Accepts only employee_id in the request body
2. Retrieves enrollment record from database (including embedded_file)
3. Validates that embedded_file exists
4. Sends employee_id AND embedded_file to all face recognition devices via WebSocket

404.description: Employee enrollment not found or embedded_file missing

get.description:
Pull enrollment updates since a known version.

Returns incremental updates (additions and removals) unless `force_full=true`.

post.description:
Upload event-triggered video clip with metadata using multipart form.

**Note:** For inline video submission with events, use `/v1/events/video` instead.

**Clip Specifications:**
- Duration: 15 seconds (10s pre-event + 5s post-event)
- Codec: H.265 (preferred) or H.264
- Max size: 10 MB

Upload batched log entries for archival.

**Batching:** 100 entries OR 30 seconds OR 500 KB

**Compression:** gzip recommended

x-websocket.description:
Real-time bidirectional communication between IoT Broker and Edge Devices.

## Connection
```
wss://acetaxi-bridge.qryde.net/iot-broker/ws/device?device_id=cam-001&token={token}
```

## Message Types
- `register` - Device registration on connect
- `registered` - Registration acknowledgment  
- `enrollment_update` - New/updated enrollment with embedded_file
- `enrollment_delete` - Remove enrollment
- `command` - Device commands (restart, config update)
- `ack` - Message acknowledgment
- `ping`/`pong` - Keep-alive
